fields.body:
[{"type": "heading", "value": "

About Ateneo SPEED

", "id": "988400d5-08ab-4874-b92f-0b9cdea13182"}, {"type": "paragraph", "value": "

Ateneo Special Education Society (SPEED) is a Sector-based Cluster Organization of the Ateneo de Manila University. We aim to provide an inclusive society for persons with special needs (PWSNs), as well as embrace their value as human beings. To do so, SPEED collaborates with various institutions to create projects that promote the advocacy inside and outside the Ateneo community, while holistically forming our members and raising awareness in the Loyola Schools community. Since then, we have garnered many accomplishments, such as, Organization of the Year in 2011 and 2018.

", "id": "7203f826-e9bb-4e41-9a34-59d6e5fcee26"}, {"type": "heading", "value": "

History

", "id": "115a1ccf-b6e7-4639-959c-bc71654627ec"}, {"type": "paragraph", "value": "

We were conceptualized by freshmen back in 1993 who participated in a Leadership Program created by the Office of Student Activities. Our first area was The Child\u2019s World, whose partnership was made possible by Jay Tan, who was one of its students and who eventually became SPEED\u2019s first president. The organization began serving through area visits officially in 1994, and became an accredited organization in Ateneo with its first constitution and officers by 1996.

", "id": "46d1f232-9ebe-489b-bdea-facdddc51500"}, {"type": "heading", "value": "

Our Mission

", "id": "5bf21729-75da-44ed-a87f-740229a96c92"}, {"type": "paragraph", "value": "

As an organization that is geared towards building an inclusive society, we empower the special needs sector by collaborating with organizations and holistically forming our members as advocates of the special needs sector.

", "id": "80655a57-2adb-491e-adf6-e24bea990191"}, {"type": "heading", "value": "

Core Competencies

", "id": "eab87084-4b68-4624-be11-26b49859accf"}, {"type": "paragraph", "value": "

1. The empowerment of persons with special needs through collaborative projects.

2. Building awareness and advocating for the special needs sector

", "id": "cd7e2307-d6e6-4b3e-b7f5-95ac26846ec9"}, {"type": "heading", "value": "

Core Values

", "id": "de62035e-9c4e-4565-a686-8929b489d3fb"}, {"type": "paragraph", "value": "

The four colors of SPEED are symbolic of our core values and our vision-mission of an inclusive society. Red denotes the love we have for PWSNs, the love they show to us, and the love we desire people to show them. Orange symbolizes the acceptance of PWSNs as valuable members of our society. Yellow represents the happiness we want to bring to the PWSNs as they discover their own abilities and capabilities. Green signifies the personal growth that we experience as we learn more about PWSNS, the sector, and the advocacy.

", "id": "bf06bd67-c677-48df-b732-2192adc0a57d"}, {"type": "heading", "value": "

Awards & Accreditation

", "id": "6b3c8d88-96b2-43ac-ac1d-3f55ca682e19"}, {"type": "paragraph", "value": "

Ten Accomplished Youth Organization, National Finalist, 2007

COA Project of the Year (Sparkle), 2009

COA Awards Executive Board of the Year, 2011

COA Awards Organization of the Year, 2011

Ten Accomplished Youth Organization Finalist, 2011

Project of the Year (SPEED Week), 2016

External Collaborative Effort of the Year (A Special Cafe), 2018

Project of the Year (A Special Cafe), 2018

Nation Building Project of the Year (Aspire), 2018

COA Awards Organization of the Year, 2018

", "id": "5cb6121e-7a85-4674-9002-72e7b94f8363"}]
